definition: Take what you hear to be false, only believe it when you see it (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: er3 ting1 wei2 xu1 , yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2

definition: ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
seeing is believing
to believe what one sees, not what one hears (idiom). Don't believe what people tell you until you see if for yourself./It ain't necessarily so.
pinyin: yan3 jian4 wei2 shi2 , er3 ting1 wei2 xu1

definition: seeing once is better than hearing a hundred times (idiom); seeing for oneself is better than hearing from many others/seeing is believing
pinyin: bai3 wen2 bu4 ru2 yi1 jian4

definition: seeing sth for oneself is better than hearing about it from others
pinyin: er3 wen2 bu4 ru2 mu4 jian4

definition: facts speak louder than words (idiom)
pinyin: shi4 shi2 sheng4 yu2 xiong2 bian4

definition: (idiom) you can't rely on a verbal agreement/just because sb says sth, doesn't mean it's true
Actual practice is the sole criterion for judging truth (item from Deng Xiaoping theory, from 1978)
pinyin: shi2 jian4 shi4 jian3 yan4 zhen1 li3 de5 wei2 yi1 biao1 zhun3
related.word: 实践是检验真理的唯一标准

definition: mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)
knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)
pinyin: wen2 ming2 bu4 ru2 jian4 mian4

definition: to travel to a place personally (idiom)
see 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量[ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2]
pinyin: hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2

definition: you can't judge a person by appearance, just as you can't measure the sea with a pint pot (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 bu4 ke3 mao4 xiang4 , hai3 shui3 bu4 ke3 dou3 liang2
related.word: 人不可貌相，海水不可斗量

definition: just as distance determines the stamina of a horse, so does time reveal a person's true heart (proverb)
pinyin: lu4 yao2 zhi1 ma3 li4 , ri4 jiu3 jian4 ren2 xin1
related.word: 路遥知马力，日久见人心

definition: gossip/hearsay/rumor
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
True gold fears no fire. (idiom)
pinyin: zhen1 jin1 bu4 pa4 huo3 lian4
